item.name: Case

request.description:
#### Request

The request requires a `projectId` query param to pull cases. If you do not submit a project ID, you'll receive an error.

The endpoint retrieves a list of cases from the specified project ID. The response is a JSON object containing an array of items, where each item represents a case. Each case object includes various attributes such as `id`, `code`, source, creation and closure timestamps, `intake survey details`, `profile` and `contact information`, `status`, assigned user and organization, and more. The `meta` object provides information about the total number of items, current page, and pagination details.

item.description: Part of the [https://care.211cs.org](https://care.211cs.org) API - this API is technically outside of the Nexus API, but complements it by giving us direct access to cases (rebuilt transaction events) and projects (a unique data structure).

item.name: Project

request.description:
The endpoint [https://care.211cs.org/api/external/projects](https://care.211cs.org/api/external/projects) responds with a JSON object containing the following properties:

- `id` (string): The unique identifier for the project.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the project.
    
- `shortName` (string): The short name or abbreviation for the project.
    
- `organizationId` (string): The identifier of the organization associated with the project.
    
- `overview` (string): A brief overview or description of the project.
    
- `surveyId` (string): The identifier of the survey associated with the project.
    
- `relatedResourceIds` (array): An array of identifiers for related resources.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp indicating when the project was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp indicating when the project was last updated.
    
- `deleted` (boolean): Indicates if the project is deleted or not.
    
- `networkId` (string): The identifier of the network associated with the project.
    
- `casesTableSettings` (object): Settings related to cases table for the project.
    
- `prefix` (string): The prefix associated with the project.
    
- `publicIntakeEnabled` (boolean): Indicates if public intake is enabled for the project.
    
- `publicIntakeHash` (string): The hash value associated with public intake.
    
- `publicIntakeThankYouUrl` (string): The URL for the thank you page after public intake submission.
    
- `csContactIntakeEnabled` (boolean): Indicates if CS contact intake is enabled for the project.
    
- `instructions` (string): Instructions related to the project.
    
- `referralDeliverySettings` (object): Settings related to referral delivery via SMS and email.
    
- `csContactIntakeDisplayControl` (object): Display control settings for CS contact intake.
    
- `carePlanEnabled` (boolean): Indicates if care plan is enabled for the project.
    
- `automationsEnabled` (boolean): Indicates if automations are enabled for the project.
    
- `referralTemplateId` (string): The identifier of the referral template associated with the project.
    
- `notifyProjectUsersEnabled` (boolean): Indicates if notification for project users is enabled.
    
- `publicIntakeSources` (array): An array of sources for public intake.
    
- `statuses` (array): An array of statuses with their unique identifiers, names, and flags.
    
- `followUpSurvey` (string): The identifier of the follow-up survey associated with the project.
    

Please note that the response may contain additional properties based on the specific project details.

response.name: GET Projects Data Example
response.body:
[
    {
        "id": "5f936754-a95f-4439-8204-bb01565e8204",
        "name": "Migration Test Project",

        "updatedAt": "2024-05-17T17:35:23.634Z",
        "deleted": null,
        "networkId": "Hx72rpOGu5mNN1Vh7aEj92UE5JXww",
        "casesTableSettings": null,
        "prefix": "MTP",
        "publicIntakeEnabled": true,
        "publicIntakeHash": "1d8538016797b19e65a1d5b8c6cc05941313c3b47e077b630e247458260d1a1a",
        "publicIntakeThankYouUrl": null,
        "csContactIntakeEnabled": false,
        "instructions": "",
        "referralDeliverySettings": {
            "sms": true,
            "email": true
        },
        "csContactIntakeDisplayControl": {},
        "carePlanEnabled": false,
        "automationsEnabled": false,
        "referralTemplateId": null,
        "notifyProjectUsersEnabled": false,
        "publicIntakeSources": [],
        "statuses": [
            {
                "id": "ce65349b-5477-4899-9f6a-6db7ac42b95c",
                "name": "New Case Created",
                "isInitial": true,
                "isFinal": false,
                "archived": false
            },
            {
                "id": "d75aad00-ea6a-4278-a60d-e7bbcfb51835",
                "name": "Address - Invalid",
                "isInitial": false,
                "isFinal": false,
                "archived": false

            {

                "name": "Case Closed",
                "isInitial": false,
                "isFinal": true,
                "archived": false
            }
        ],
        "followUpSurvey": null
    }
]

item.description: Part of the [https://care.211cs.org](https://care.211cs.org) API - Projects are a CS Care data model that governs who has access to individual cases. It also creates a permission structure for users that are "added" to a project.

* @param {Object} expected - The allowed keys for the base object.
* @param {Object} actual - The actual object to compare.
* @returns {Array} Array of mismatch messages (empty if matching).

// Check for extra keys at the base level.
mismatches.push("Extra key at base level: " + key);
// For the "metadata" field, compare extra keys only.
* Validates a GET collection response which should have a __meta object and a data array.
* @param {Object} expectedMetaSchema - Expected structure for the __meta object.
* @param {Object} expectedDataSchema - Expected structure for each item in the data array.

// Auto-capture new schema if mismatches are found on a 20Ã— response.

* Validates a GET /:id response, which returns a single data object.
